I understand from the Ministry of Information that they have now sent your photograph by El win Nea*e and a cliche made from it to Bahrein. Yours sincerely. .HgCl.) R. Bated Bahrein, 11.10 hrs. 21.6.43. Heed. 12.15 hours, 21.6.43. Following for Peel. Begins In continuation of Prior 8 s— jfi.telegram No.1396 dated June 16th ^Please arrange metal cliche also photograph by air mail. and s. 270.DRAFT LETTER. 'b Ext. 3346/45- © H.D. Gra.ves Law, Esq., G.I.S. , Ministry of Information. m/r/4 0 . 0 . 2 3 JUN 19435 • A ''cliche 1 is a stereo. The Telegraph Branch say that as the telegram was sent in Confidential Code there is no possible alternative reading for the word 'head'. n.o. Dear G-raves Law, I enclose a copy of a personal telegram No .'1396 dated the loth June ) from Lieut.Colonel Sir G-eoffrey Prior, the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, regarding a stereo to be made from a photograph of himself by Elwin Neame of Old Bond Street. As this stereo is required by the Public Relations 06 Officer in the Persian Gulf and £the Political Resident suggests that 14) should be nade in ■ the Ministry of Information/! am for.varding the telegram to you. Perhaps you would be good enough to take the necessary action. There does not appear to be an aljerndtive reading for the word 'head' in the second line. Possibly it is a technical term v/hich may be known to you. (Sgd.) R. PELL* ■ ~ t HL'~ r.OPY * f Tjr-% .* ^ x imj.ARD telegram 334 02507 ^ 1 ? 1943 Allotted to ^.xternaX Department c ^ ^ OQNglD^TAL GODS TSLEOft AM Political Resident in Persian Gulf Secretary of State for India From To Dated Bushire, 15*15 hours, 16th June 1945 Received 03*20 hours, 17th June 1943, No. 1396* Addressed to Secretary of State for India copy by post to Public Relations Officer Persian Gulf Bahrain* Peel from Prior, Public Relations Officer has asked me for photograph of myself to be (?head) for making Cliche;* I have no copy available but SI win Neame, 4-l‘?8) old Bond Street, have suitable one reference number 0 /641835 of (I think) 1936, If still available I suggest Ministry of Information have Cliche made of this and despatched to Balmain*I Cover for Enclosures in Weekly Letter No. P.Z dated from Secretary, Political and Secret Department (External), India Office, to Foreign Secretary, Foreign and Political Depart- ment, Government of India.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 3518/43 'Pol. Resident's Request for Photograph of himself'

physicalDescription.extent: The file's contents are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 10; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of letters between Graves Law, Ministry of Information, Roland Tennyson Peel and E W R Lumby, and the India Office which discuss photographing Lieutenant-Colonel Sir Geoffrey Prior, the Public Relations Officer in the Persian Gulf.

name.namePart: Secretary of State for India, United Kingdom
